name: Companion Acute Smell
description: The symphony of odors, the spectacle of sensation, the rich epics told by every passing breeze or warm surface - humans sense these things but dimly. Virtually every land animal and every creeping thing, however, knows and understands the language of smells. Level 1 (2 points): Adds two dice to Perception rolls involving scent. Level 2 (3 points): Adds three dice, making scent the dominant sense for virtually all Perception rolls.

name: Alacrity
description: Capable of bursts of inhuman speed, you can strike before most people can think. Each two points spent allows you to spend a Willpower point and take one extra action within a single turn, up to a maximum of four actions at 6 points. This bonus lasts only one turn per Willpower point spent.

name: Armor
description: Provides innate protection, such as thick hide or armor plates. Each point provides one soak die, up to 5 dice. Double cost allows soaking of aggravated damage.

name: Aura
description: Uncanny radiance surrounds you, reflecting your essential nature. Opponents suffer +3 difficulty on rolls against you, neutral characters sense aura effects. May suppress aura for a scene with a Willpower point. As a Flaw, this Trait cannot be suppressed.

name: Aww!
description: You're so adorable that people tend to give you more slack than your activities deserve. Every point adds one die to Social rolls based on cuteness. Half bonus (rounded up) applies in human form.

name: Bare Necessities
description: You can shape-change with your clothing and small possessions intact. 1 point: Retains small items worn close to the skin. 3 points: Retains small carried items like backpacks or swords. Items essentially disappear when shapeshifting and cannot be used until returning to natural form.

name: Bioluminescence
description: Your body can glow and you can turn this light on/off at will. 1 point: Dim cell phone brightness. 2 points: Brighter or directable. 3 points: Both bright and directable. Can blind targets temporarily with successful Dexterity + Perception roll.

name: Blending
description: Ability to alter appearance to match surroundings. Can slowly acclimate over a scene or quickly with Wits + Survival roll (difficulty 8). Quintessence/Gnosis users may spend a point to blend immediately. Successful blending adds +2 difficulty to perceive the creature.

name: Bond-Sharing
description: Creates a mystical bond between companions to share abilities. 4 points: Companion can use one sense or withstand one environment. 5 points: Can go anywhere you can or feel anything you feel. 6 points: Both effects. Bond spans roughly half a mile but works best in close proximity.

name: Cause Insanity
description: Can provoke temporary fits of madness in targets within visual range. Spend Willpower and roll one die per two points in this power against target's Willpower. Each success causes temporary derangement for one day. Three or more successes against mages may cause Quiet.

name: Chameleon Coloration
description: Ability to change coloration for camouflage. 4 points: Shadow-Walking in darkness. 6 points: Color matching within a single hue. 8 points: Full environmental color matching. Perceiving a camouflaged creature requires Wits + Alertness roll (difficulty 7).

name: Companion Natural Weaponry
description: Natural weaponry that inflicts lethal damage. 3 points: One form of attack. 5 points: Two forms. 7 points: All three forms. Double cost for aggravated damage. Attacks use specific combat maneuvers: Bite (diff 5, Str+1), Claw (diff 6, Str+2), Gore (diff 7, Str+2 or Str+4 after charge).

name: Deadly Demise
description: Upon death, inflicts damage to nearby enemies within 30 feet. 2 points: 4 dice lethal damage. 4 points: 6 dice lethal damage. 6 points: 8 dice lethal or 6 dice aggravated damage. Triggers when dropping below Incapacitated from lethal/aggravated damage.

name: Soul-Sense
description: Ability to sense spirits and impending death. 2 points: Sense spirits or imminent death with Perception + Awareness roll. 3 points: Detect auras around those near death. May also sense impending births or life forces.

name: Dominance
description: Naturally commanding demeanor within specific groups. Adds three dice to Social interactions and reduces Intimidation or Leadership roll difficulties by 2 when dealing with appropriate groups.

name: Earthbond
description: A mystical connection to surroundings that helps perceive threats. Reduces difficulty of perception rolls by 2 when trying to spot potential trouble. May not detect supernatural concealments or beings entering from other realms.

name: Elemental Touch
description: Control over a single element. 3 points: Sense large quantities within half-mile. 5 points: Minor manipulations. 7 points: Alter small quantities. 10 points: Conjure element or greater control. 15 points: Large-scale manipulation. Higher levels require Willpower expenditure.

name: Companion Enhancement
description: Superior physical or mental attributes beyond human norm. Each five points allows purchase of one additional Attribute dot above 5, or one extra Health Level above 8. Maximum suggested cap of 8 total dots for Attributes and three extra Health Levels.

name: Empathic Bond
description: Ability to sense and influence emotions like Mind 1 Effect. Can shield own feelings and surface thoughts. May influence mood of others by spending Willpower. Requires focus to connect and may be ethically questionable if used without consent.

name: Extra Heads
description: Each two points provides one additional head. Each head adds two dice to Perception rolls, increases mind-control resistance difficulty by 2, and allows additional bite attacks. Multiple heads may have different personalities that don't always agree.

name: Extra Limbs
description: Each two points provides an additional prehensile limb. Each limb adds one die to dice pools for multiple actions, using highest pool instead of lowest. One action per two limbs involved. Additional uses depend on limb type and Storyteller discretion.

name: Feast of Nettles
description: Ability to absorb and nullify Paradox. 2 points: Three points per week. 3 points: Five points per week. 4 points: Ten points per week. 5 points: Fifteen points per week. 6 points: Twenty points per week. Exceeding limit is fatal.

name: Ferocity
description: Grants Rage points (one per two points spent) that can be used to: add health levels to successful attacks, perform additional actions, ignore wound penalties for one turn, or penetrate armor. Requires rest to recover spent points.

name: Ghost Form
description: 8 points: Become invisible at will. 10 points: Achieve complete incorporeality, immune to physical attacks. Requires Willpower expenditure to maintain. Getting stuck in alternate form possible if Willpower depleted.

name: Mesmerism
description: 3 points: Freeze prey with gaze. 6 points: Draw targets into trance. Requires Charisma + Intimidation/Seduction roll against target's Willpower. Effects last minimum three turns, then target may attempt escape with Willpower rolls.

name: Musical Influence
description: Ability to affect emotions through music. Roll appropriate Social Attribute + Ability against target's Willpower. Effects last while music plays. Additional successes affect larger groups. Targets can resist if they recognize manipulation.

name: Musk
description: Emit powerful stench that adds +2 difficulty to all rolls (+4 for enhanced senses). Can spray targets within range using Dexterity + Athletics. Effects last one day. Stamina roll (difficulty 7-9) may overcome penalties.

name: Mystic Shield
description: Resistance to magic. One countermagic die per two points spent, maximum five dice. Adds +1 difficulty per two points against supernatural powers. Must actively defend; doesn't work if caught unaware.

name: Needleteeth
description: Sharp teeth and powerful jaws bypass up to three levels of armor when biting. Leaves severe bleeding wounds. Enhances biting attacks only.

name: Companion Nightsight
description: Clear vision in low light conditions. In total darkness, Perception + Alertness roll (difficulty 8) reveals vague outlines. May be hindered by specific environmental conditions at Storyteller's discretion.

name: Omega Status
description: Power in being overlooked. Lowers difficulty of Scrounging, Stealth, Streetwise, and Subterfuge rolls by -2 within relevant social group. Must be part of a significant hierarchical structure to benefit.

name: Paradox Nullification
description: Ability to consume Paradox energies. 2 points: One point per month. 3 points: One point per two weeks. 4 points: One point per week. 5 points: Two points per week. 6 points: One point per day. Must be within arm's reach of mage.

name: Quills
description: Sharp defensive spines. 2 points: Contact damage (Strength dice as lethal). 4 points: Can shoot quills up to 30 feet (Dexterity + Athletics). Lodged quills require removal and cause additional damage. Limited by character's Stamina rating.

name: Rapid Healing
description: Accelerated recovery from injuries. Every two points advances healing rate by one category on the Healing Damage charts. Maximum eight points for faster recovery from lethal and aggravated damage.

name: Razorskin
description: Skin that shreds on contact. Causes Strength +1 lethal damage to attackers using bare-handed attacks. Always active unless shapeshifted or covered. Requires careful handling for intimate contact.

name: Read and Write
description: Ability to read and write in any known human language despite non-human form. Physical limitations may affect method of reading/writing, but comprehension is equal to human capacity.

name: Regrowth
description: Ability to regenerate lost body parts. 2 points: Minor parts (tail, horn). 4 points: Major parts (limbs, eyes). 6 points: Vital organs. Regeneration takes 1 day for minor parts, 3 days for limbs, 1 week for vital organs. Fire/acid can prevent regeneration.

name: Shapechanger
description: Ability to assume different forms. 3 points: One alternate form. 5 points: Any form within limited range (e.g., all birds). 8 points: Any form, special traits require additional Advantages. Transformation typically takes one turn.

name: Shared Knowledge
description: Mystic bond allowing shared understanding. 5 points: Share any Knowledge within 50 feet. 7 points: Also gain shared vision through each other's eyes. Bond works up to Willpower x 100 yards. Requires conscious connection.

name: Companion Size
description: Significantly larger or smaller than human norm. 3 points: Slightly different. 5 points: Notably different. 8 points: Considerably different. 10 points: Immensely different. Each level affects Health Levels, Attributes, and detection difficulty.

name: Spirit Travel
description: Ability to cross the Gauntlet into Umbral realms. 8 points: Access to one realm. 10 points: Two realms. 15 points: All three realms. Requires Willpower point and roll against Gauntlet rating. Success determines crossing time from instant to three turns.

name: Spirit Vision
description: Ability to perceive the Penumbra and local spirit world. Can sense spirits and spiritual atmosphere. Requires concentration to focus on one realm. Spirits can usually tell if they're being observed.

name: Soak Lethal Damage
description: Natural ability to soak lethal damage as if it were bashing damage. May be due to hardy frame, thick skin, great size, or elemental composition.

name: Soak Aggravated Damage
description: Ability to soak both lethal and aggravated damage using natural soak dice. Represents extreme durability beyond normal physical limits.

name: Tunneling
description: Can create tunnels through earth at half walking speed. Tunnel size matches body size. Method varies by creature type (eating dirt, burrowing, etc.).

name: Unaging
description: Complete immunity to natural aging process. Useful for stories spanning multiple time periods or bridging historical and modern narratives.

name: Universal Translator
description: Can understand and communicate in any language. Requires Intelligence + Empathy roll (difficulty 6-9) for new languages. Must recognize communication as language. Initial translations tend to be literal.

name: Venom
description: Poisonous attack delivered through specific method. Every three points inflicts one level of aggravated damage. Effects trigger one turn after attack and three turns later. Five points per level allows skin contact delivery.

name: Wall-Crawling
description: Ability to climb sheer surfaces easily. No roll needed under normal conditions. Extreme conditions may require Dexterity + Athletics rolls.

name: Water Breathing
description: 2 points: Can breathe underwater naturally. 5 points: No breathing required at all, suited for various environments.

name: Webbing
description: Can spin webs with six soak dice and three health levels. Uses include travel, crafting large webs, snaring foes, and blocking entrances. Trapped victims need three Strength successes to escape.

name: Companion Wings
description: Flight capability. 3 points: Normal jogging speed (13 yards/turn). 5 points: Up to 20 yards/turn. Can involve physical wings or mystical levitation.

name: Hibernation
description: Toads may sleep in mud for centuries and awaken as though only a morning had passed. Bears take to their caves for the winter, and consume no food therein. Like these somnolent beasts, you can go to sleep, needing no food or water until you awaken. Like the fox, you may even seem dead to others - it takes magic of some kind to notice signs of life. You need only buy this Advantage if your hibernation is completely voluntary. Automatic or mandatory hibernation falls under the Flaw: Compulsion.

name: Immunity
description: As the cock withstands the searing poison of the basilisk, you can ignore the effect of some dangerous (or at least unpleasant) thing. Some Immunities are part and parcel of a beast's nature; others, like Mithradites' immunity to poison, accrue over a long period of conditioning. Immunities vary in price, depending on their lethality and their frequency, much as Vulnerabilities do. You must buy each Immunity separately, although the Storyteller may allow a number of similar Immunities (basilisks, snakes, toadstools, iocaine powder) to be packaged as one more common Immunity (poisons).

name: Information Fount
description: Augurs have always known that hidden information is revealed by animals. Magical creatures may have access to even more esoteric lore. For the human mystic, such communions serve as conduits between the world of humanity and the hidden hearts of nature. To the beast, it might simply serve as a new way to earn food and shelter, or perhaps as a bond between friends or allies. Magical beasts, especially familiars, come up with seemingly bizarre yet often helpful information at unpredictable intervals. These fragments of lore, forgotten songs or helpful rumors seem fairly cryptic to humans, and the human concepts necessary to explain them are often completely foreign to you, the beast. You feel that this wisdom should be instantly comprehensible, and you find humans, used to different ways of thought and feeling, frustratingly slow on the uptake. This complex trade of insights, concepts and misunderstandings makes for enjoyably off-the-wall roleplaying. As a player, feel free to make cryptic remarks and weird allusions; the humans around you can figure out what you mean if they're so damned smart! If and when a system is called for, the Storyteller can allow you to attempt a Perception + Ability roll (difficulty 7) to come suitably obscure revelation. The specific Ability may be matched to the situation (Fairy Lore in a situation involving the Good Folk), analogous (Hunting while observing the Borgia Papal court), or seemingly irrelevant (Intimidation while trying to decipher a mysterious inscription). The better your roll, the more accurate your observation. To understand you, the puzzled human's player should roll her Intelligence + Enigmas Dice Pool - her difficulty could range from 6 to 10, depending on how weird the observation was. Both players may roll only once per situation.

name: Intangibility
description: You can disappear from plain sight (eight points) or become totally incorporeal as well (10 points). Going intangible (in either variety) does not require a roll, but it does cost one point of Willpower whenever you shift from one state to the other. Running out of Willpower traps you in your current state until you can recover. An incorporeal beast cannot be physically touched or harmed; True Faith, magick and other mystical attacks and forces can transcend this protection, however. Before he can orient himself to address (or attack) aphysical being, the incorporeal beast must 'fade in' for a turn or so, achieving a sort of shadowy half-physical state which can be touched normally, but which proves difficult to see (Perception + Awareness or Alertness, difficulty 8). Normal human observers will have no way to find an intangible target, although vampiric Auspex, Lifesight and sensing Gifts and magicks will detect you on a normal Perception + Alertness roll (difficulty 7). If you remain corporeal, you still affect your surroundings and perhaps make noise, and a sharp observer can locate you from these disturbances with a Perception + Alertnessroll (difficulty9). More importantly, this Advantage does not mask your smell, thus dogs, for instance, will barely notice the difference between visible and invisible prey. A lack of scent is worth three points, and can be bought on its own or in addition to Intangibility.

name: Healing Lick
description: As penance cleanses the wounds of the soul, the tongue of certain hounds heals wounds to the body. You have the gift of healing, whether by tongue (as the hound), breath (as the panther) or some other means. For three points, you may restore one Health Level per turn to either yourself or to another creature. For six points, you may heal one Health Level of an aggravated wound per turn. This Advantage heals only wounds and burns, not poison, broken bones, damaged organs or other traumas.

name: Human Speech
description: In Russian legend, all animals can speak in human tongues (or at least in Russian) on Christmas Eve. You may wish to speak to humans more often than that, however. If so, this Advantage grants both the ability to speak in a recognizably human voice, and facility in one human language of your choice. Additional languages should be bought as the Languages merit, of course.

name: Human Guise
description: You have a human form you can wear when required. For the two-point version of this Advantage you present a few tells. These could be semi-visible gills, cat eyes, or hints of your reptile scales poking out from under that neat human skin you’ve thrown on. The two-point version of this Advantage comes with one dot in Appearance. Your tells can be covered up with makeup and or the right type of clothing, but it’s fairly clear that you are not quite what you appear to be. The four-point version of this Advantage gives you a completely normal human guise with no obvious tells. Powers and abilities that can uncover a being’s true form are the only way to discern that you are something other than a mild-mannered reporter (or whatever).

name: Flexible
description: The serpent twists and coils like a rhetorician's argument. You, too, can bend your body double, loop around limbs and squeeze your opponents until their breath leaves. You receive a -2 to Athletics rolls to dodge and -2 to Brawl rolls when starting grapple.

name: Telepathy
description: You might not be able to speak with your mouth, but you can speak with your mind. This Advantage allows, for example, a sword, a horse, or a quivering pool of sentient goo to hold conversations with anyone who understands what that character is trying to say. The recipient of the telepathy must be able to comprehend your conversation, of course, though certain phrases or empathic bursts may transcend a language barrier. (Roll Intelligence + Empathy, Etiquette, Intimidation or other appropriate Traits as needed.) That party may also, with a successful resisted Willpower roll, block out what you're trying to say. You can talk, but they aren't compelled to listen. Assuming both parties want to talk, and can understand what the other one is saying, you're able to silently converse with one other character within an unobstructed range of sight (2 pts.); with one other character for each point of Willpower you possess (4 pts.); and perhaps transcend obstacles and talk to characters you already know and have bonded with, even when you cannot see each other, across distances of roughly a mile or so (6 pts.). For organic and spirit-beings, this Advantage reflects a psychic or spiritual communion; tech-oriented characters may be using communication devices instead. However the telepathy is defined, outside parties cannot hear it unless they employ a suitable method (psychic power, the Mind Sphere, radio transmissions, etc.) to tap into it and spend a point of Willpower in order to do so. You might be using transmission technology, but if so, it's not the sort of tech the average listener can access or employ.

name: Telekinesis
description: With the power of your mind, antigravity hypertech, mystic energy, or what-have-you, you can lift and - to a slight degree - manipulate objects from a distance, without physically touching them. Doing so requires a successful Willpower roll, and the difficulty of that roll depends upon the weight and accessibility of your target, combined with the effect you're trying to have on it. Difficulty Target 6 Moving up to 10 lbs. 7 Up to 20 lbs. 8 Up to 50 lbs. 9 Up to 100 lbs.* +1 Basic manipulation (flipping lever, opening container) +2 Fine manipulation (pushing buttons, starting car) +3 Precise manipulation (typing accurately, driving car**) *Attempting to lift objects over 100 lbs. requires one Willpower point spent for each additional 25 lbs. **Steering a vehicle is not the same as trying to lift it; assuming you can get in and start the machine, your base difficulty would be 9. You must be able to see your target in order to influence it with this Advantage, and the cost of the Trait determines the maximum amount of weight you can lift: • (3 points) Maximum 10 lbs. • (5 points) Maximum 50 lbs. • (8 points) Maximum 100 lbs. • (12 points) No maximum.

name: Tides of Fortune
description: Invoking the fickle currents of fortune, you can employ a combination of the spirit powers Bad Luck Charm and Good Luck Charm. Instead of spending a point of Essence, you must spend a point of Willpower to confer ill or happy fortune upon the target of your whims. For details about those Charms, see below

name: Speed
description: You're a lot faster than you look. For every two points spent on this Advantage (up to a maximum of 10 points), you add + 2 yards (or meters) to your Base Move on the ground. That Base Move can be found on the Movement Rates chart in Mage 20, p. 401. Thus, six points spent on Speed gives you a Base Walk of 13 yards, a Base Jog of 18 yards, and a Base run of 26 yards. If you can fly as well, this Advantage also adds + 5 yards to your Base Fly movement for every two points spent. Therefore, that same six points also allows a winged character a Base Fly of 25 to 35 yards per turn. You do not have to purchase a separate Speed Advantage for flying, though you must have some innate ability (wings, levitation, etc.) in order to use that additional speed in the air. This Advantage does not add to temporary flight powers, such as flying carpets, levitation spells, and so on; the ability to fly must be a natural part of your character first. Due to the heavy resistance involved, this Advantage does not confer extra swimming speed, though an exception might be made (Storyteller's option) if the character is native to the water.
